hints.content: First, find the bar that is for the park.

Next, find the number that is even with the top of the $\red{\text{Park}}$ bar.

This number tells us how many kids are at the park.

$~$

[[☃ image 1]]

$~$

options.alt:
A vertical bar graph. Place is on
the horizontal axis. Number of Kids is on the vertical axis and has lines marking from 0 to 10. There are bars for each of the Places: 1 bar for Park, 1 bar for Pool, and 1 bar for Beach.
•Park, 9. 
•Pool, 4.
• Beach, 6.

The number 9 is circled in Red on the vertical axis with a line extending to the Park bar. The label Park is in Red on the horizontal axis.

hints.content: There are $\red9$ kids at the park.

question.content:
Groups of kids are at the park, pool, or beach.

This bar graph shows how many kids are at each place.

[[☃ image 1]]

 **How many kids are at the park?**  

[[☃ input-number 1]] kids
